job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Bronx, NY
pros: Good work environment , good work life balance
cons: It would be nice to get b Paid more

pros: Great training ground for medical personnel
cons: Patient volume is high, but there is a lot of need in the Bronx

pros: Decent benefits and vacations with sick time. Good community serving the underserved.
cons: No structure, poor organization overall with HR, all departments, lack of staff, poor incentives even with continuing education. Very poor selection of managers with no experience. Pay is low compare to other companies if you get a higher pay or increase they require a bigger title/ duties.

review_title: Take the good with the bad
pros: I met some really great people working with MHHC
cons: Administration will ride you hard regarding the numbers, you can always see more patients!

pros: One of my pros would be I was able to gain experience. Met great wonderful people.
cons: You have to kiss up to management if you want a higher position. Front desk have been verbally harassed by patient and nothing is done. People get hired and when they become lazy or have too many errors they get away with it. This place is just a great way to get your experience and keep it moving.

pros: Good place to gain experienxe
cons: Pay is not good enough

review_title: Great for getting work experience and nothing else.
pros: Health insurance, FSA, Easily accessible by public transportation, ability to get overtime
cons: This is a place you work only to gain job experience, not to stay long term. You are constantly being micromanaged, leadership is disorganized,  unprofessional and the work environment is very toxic. If you struggle with kissing up to senior leadership this isn't the place for you. C-Suite is constantly changing and HR is a revolving door.

job_title: IT Help Desk Technician in Bronx, NY
pros: Very relaxed environment and not so fast paced
cons: Human resource is not too proactive

pros: Full time work, 1199, union reps
cons: Management needs to stop gossiping

pros: The patients are the most amazing people.
cons: There are times when the communication within the organization is less than ideal.

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in New York, NY
pros: benefits, union, night shifts, vacation
cons: understaffed, inconsistent schedule, low pay, management

job_title: Senior Managing Director in New York, NY
pros: Everyone is committed to a common goal.
cons: none are apparent at this early point in my employment.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Great front line staff. Really kind people who love what they do.
cons: Late manager was highly overbearing, always in destress, and with her snappy tendencies, which was a regular occurrence, destroyed the joy we, as her subordinates, had for the work experience before she became our supervisor.

job_title: Call Center Representative in Bronx, NY
pros: They offer healthcare and flexible spending account.
cons: Micromanagement from the supervisor and how condescending she is. Beware that she keeps records of every mistake you make. In case she wants to fire you.

pros: To be quite frank that only pro about working at MHHC is the proximity to my home and my site.
cons: Management- most people in management are there because of nepotism. Most hold titles they have no business having.

job_title: Medical Assistant in New York, NY
pros: schedule management is good and they work with yu=ou
cons: late nights are tired sometimes

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in Bronx, NY
pros: Great supportive Staff. Benefits were good. Enjoy working with out clients.
cons: They were going through change and growing so it was chaotic at this time.

review_title: Great job if you want to  work in the medical field
pros: The benefit are good, become part of the 1199 union in 90 day after probation offer 401 k, medical dental and vision
cons: Always understaffed and must work one late night depending on the site you work.

pros: Loved working with patients from all over the world. Union contract.
cons: Lack of respect from management and instability.

review_title: not the place to work for
pros: there team players in some sites
cons: the higher people dont help you have opportunities

pros: Accessible commute, salaries, diverse, office perks
cons:
not many career building perks
growth is limited

job_title: Call Center Representative in Bronx, NY
pros: Great benefits, good stepping stone in the medical industry
cons: No opportunities for advancement, pay is mediocre, upper management is never available

review_title: Love my work; but the organization is dysfunctional.
pros: If you want to work with a community that really needs your help, this is the place. There are profound needs in this community and every day you will feel satisfied that you are meeting those needs. I love the work I get to do and look forward to every day.
cons: The organization is vastly dysfunctional; morale is low and turnover is through the roof. The CEO makes it a point to publicly embarrass staff and chastise them as though they were children and not the professionals they are. The organization seems to be stuck in a time warp - procedures and management tactics and behavior are reminiscent of NY in the 1970s not 2014.

review_title: Not a great place to work
pros: Can't think of any. It is used to be an awesome place to work but since the beginning of the year it is not so.
cons: Stressful place to work. If you are looking for stability, this is not the place to work.    Employees are not happy and stressed out.  This  is transmitted to the patients.  The organization is mostly led by the Board who have no idea of what they are doing, don't care, spend time creating useless processes with short term focus.   With the Board taking over the working of the organization,  it is no longer the great and awesome place to work as it once was.  They are super disorganized.

review_title: Great Mission; falls short on many areas
pros: The organization has a great mission and some great people; the CEO has announced her resignation and as a result, the organization may be going in a different and perhaps more organizationally positive direction.
cons: Much dysfunction here - low morale and serious brain drain here - excellent staff leave for other organizations who pay more leaving behind the more unprofessional staff and those who are unable to find employment elsewhere.

review_title: Great mission, but misses the mark
pros: The mission of this organization is great. I loved that my job ultimately helped the community we served, directly and indirectly. This isn't a very stressful organziation. You work hard, but you won't be expected to stay late, work on weekends or be available afterhours. Great work/life balance.
cons: The leadership of the organization is constantly changing, and that's reflected in the disorganization from the top to the bottom. It's also hard to advance your career here. You will get stuck after a while.

review_title: It's an OK place to work
job_title: Business Associate II in New York, NY
pros: The community that you serve really do need the help
cons:
Salary for entry level is low.  Not well organized at least the department I work for. MHHC is growing fast it seems that every year or year and half there another location opening up.  
But management fails to fix the problem that already exist with the current locations. There is a high turn over of employees management fails to address this issue. Lacks of benefits

pros: Coworkers are great, treat each other like family, Manager sometime play favoritism
cons:
Low wages, management are always being switch around, call center is the worst , patient can never get through, there is always a shortage of staff, staff are always being switch around to cover other sites. 
Workers are always quitting as they are overworked.

review_title: The worst experience of my professional career
pros: In theory, the organizational views and focus are ideal for a population that otherwise would go neglected
cons: Very poor morale. Poor work environment. Poor employees benefits. Constant change in reporting relationships. An exorbitant rate of turnover.

pros: Mission driven organization with diverse and comprehensive services. Provides primary and sub-specialty care. Long standing commitment to the community served.
cons: Distinct work silos; ineffective communication between staff and leadership. Leadership that does not encourage discussion and/or questioning. Organization lacks focus.

pros: Morris Heights Health Center is an outstanding company that services our community above and behind their necessary duties. There are a variety of departments within the company that can assist your whole entire family. They are also affordable for families with low income.
cons: There is no down side working at Morris Heights Health Center.

pros: The people here are caring, committed, and hard working. There are strong small teams that bond together and make incremental positive changes.
cons: Salaries are low for all but the chosen few who seem unable to provide effective leadership. Turnover is high, even at senior levels. Management is uneven and siloed.

pros: Great benefits, amazing work they do. People without insurance are able to be seen. Paid days off/ holidays, 1199 for all employees
cons: Low pay, very strict, absolutely toxic, management will put your business out in front of everyone, unprofessional

review_title: take a chance you may like working their
pros: doctor and staff or very professional they really care about the patient.
cons: management treat employees poorly

review_title: I love my coworkers, but working as a nurse here is not easy at all.
pros: Co workers are wonderful people.
cons: Management changes so much that we are always hearing new policies from different people. Communication sucks here.

review_title: Organization has undergone a total change in administration with addition of the union within a year.
pros: Now represented by 1199 union, so improvement in pay and benefits.
cons: Administration is at times very difficult to reason with, are all new and disorganized, making the work environment uncomfortable. Lots of turnover in positions.

pros:
Got to meet some great kids
Learned a lot about options counseling and sexual health
Incentives for meeting criteria for client visits
cons:
Medical insurance premiums too expensive
EMR system slow

pros: Staff was always support and great group to work with
cons: Management is going through changes which caused a lot of uncertainty with staff.

pros: The employees are friendly, great Customer Service, and understanding to the clients
cons: Need communication skills with employees

pros: Great coworkers, good support,
cons: In the middle of Union transition so it has to be seen how it affects us as a whole.
